meanings.definition: To parent a child jointly with another person.
meanings.sent1: They coparented their children after the divorce.
meanings.sent2: The couple coparented their kids successfully despite living apart.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors coparented a puppy they found on the street.
meanings.sent4: The team coparented the project, each member contributing equally.
meanings.sent5: She coparented her niece with her sister, creating a loving family dynamic.

meanings.definition: Having shared responsibility for raising a child with another person.
meanings.sent1: The coparented couple attended all school events together.
meanings.sent2: The coparented arrangement allowed both parents to be involved.
meanings.sent3: The coparented family always had a full house during holidays.
meanings.sent4: The coparented siblings supported each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The coparented household was filled with love and laughter.
